section.title: start-address and end-address Deprecated in the Input Model (DOCS-2927)
section.p: start-address and end-address have been deprecated in favour of addresses in the Input Model. The latter provides more flexibility in specifying ranges and so is the preferred method to use.
An example showing how to use the addresses parameter is available here.
You do not have to update your Input Model to start using addresses. However, you may see warnings like the following when you run the configuration processor:
section.codeblock: "# networks-2.0 WRN: Network EXTERNAL-API-NET: start-address and end-address are deprecated. Instead specify an address range in 'addresses'", "# networks-2.0 WRN: Network GUEST-NET: start-address and end-address are deprecated. Instead specify an address range in 'addresses'", "# networks-2.0 WRN: Network MANAGEMENT-NET: start-address and end-address are deprecated. Instead specify an address range in 'addresses'",

section.title: Resolving Git Merge Conflicts During Upgrade (DOCS-2891)
Nova Resize and Nova Migrate Features may be Disabled after Upgrade
section.p: If you had enabled the Nova Resize or the Nova Migrate feature in your cloud, the features may be disabled after you perform the upgrade procedure. You can re-enable these features by following the steps here.

section.title: Delete Alarms that are no longer supported
section.p: A number of alarms that were supported in have been removed in . After a successful upgrade, these alarms will be in the UNDETERMINED state. You can delete the obsolete alarms by following the appropriate procedure on the Alarm Resolutions page.
For example, the alarms for ceilometer-agent-central and ceilometer-collector components can be deleted manually using the monasca alarm-delete <alarm-id> command.
